course_description: This course will survey a number of classic issues in bioethics that have been in the forefront of the bioethical movement in the United States for at least the last two decades, as well as the context of the healthcare system. Topics have been chosen because of their enduring character as well as how they embody trenchant conflicts over values and ethical principles.   By appreciating the nature of these conflicts, students will achieve a considerable insight into the nature and limits of rational, principled argument for resolving bioethical debate.
sections: Class Nbr: 5744, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 2:30-5:30p, Instructor: Crane/Kinlaw, Status: Open
